results.title: Live and let die (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Guy Hamilton, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Live and let die heralded the arrival of Roger Moore as 007, it also featured a pre title sequence in which James Bond does not appear. Instead, there are the deaths of 3 agents, including a funeral procession which turns into street party and murder at a voodoo ceremony. 007 is entrusted with finding a connection between the deaths and travels to Harlem where he is exposed to a network of African Americans working for “Mr Big” (Yaphet Kotto). On the Caribbean island of San Monique he encounters Dr Katanga, owner of a large plantation of opium poppies. Accompanied by inept agent Rosie Carver (Gloria Hendry), Bond only has eyes for Solitaire (Jane Seymour), secret weapon of Dr Katanga’s with her fortune telling capabilities that are in danger of disappearing, should she fall in love. Shot on location in New Orleans (which also dictated a lot of the action sequences), notable scenes include a double decker bus chase, crocodiles snapping at 007’s heels, snakes (of varying degrees of realism), and a hook handed henchman.

results.title: Little Odessa
results.creator_credit: James Gray, Paul Webster and Immigrant Pictures (US)
results.brief_description: A Jewish-Russian hitman, Joshua Shapira (Tim Roth) returns to his family in Brighton Beach, New York, on a job. The town is referred to as ‘Little Odessa’, so called because of the influence of the Russian mob. Joshua is not a welcome presence as he disappeared in disgrace years ago for his reputation as a hitman, only his younger brother Reuben (Edward Furlong) and terminally ill mother (Vanessa Redgrave) welcome his presence. Joshua must lay low as rumours spread around of his arrival and neither Joshua or his familyn are safe from the violence that’s brewing in Little Odessa. Cast also includes Maximilian Schell, Moira Kelly and Paul Guilfoyle.

results.title: Little Caesar
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Hal B. Wallis and First National Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘Little Caesar’ made Edward G.Robinson a star and exemplified the 1930’s gangster movie. Robinson plays “little tough guy” Caesar Enrico Bandello, whom with his cohort Joe Massara played by Douglas Fairbanks Jr., head for the big city in pursuit of power and wealth. His ruthlessness sees him climb to the top over his rivals, but success is short-lived in a world filled with violence and corruption. Mervyn Le Roy hired three mobsters as advisors and the film’s authenticity is a testimony to his attention to detail and fascination for the subject matter.

results.title: Lipstick on your collar
results.creator_credit: Rosemarie Whitman, Whistling Gypsy Production for Channel 4 and Renny Rye
results.brief_description: By acclaimed writer Dennis Potter, “Lipstick on your collar” is a romantic comedy which transports the viewer back to the 1950’s and the era of rock and roll. Mick Hopper, working in the War Office as part of his National Service, uses his imagination to escape the drudgery and bully boy officers. By transporting them into his fantasies as rock and roll singers he deals with the harshness of life. When Private Francis, a young Welshman joins Mick, they join forces. Often astonishing and never dull, “Lipstick on your collar” is a must for all Dennis Potter fans.

results.title: Like it is
results.creator_credit: Paul Oremland, Tracey Gardiner and Channel Four Films
results.brief_description: This low-budget romantic drama marks Paul Oremland’s directorial debut. Craig is a 21 year old boxer from Blackpool, making cash from illegal bare-knuckle fights. A chance meeting outside a club leads him to a brief sexual encounter with Matt, a self-assured disc-jockey from London. He flees the escalating violence of Blackpool and turns up on Matt’s doorstep where he is introduced to the freedom of Soho, an openly gay world he never imagined existed. As the pair become more involved the illusions on which their relationship is built begins to crumble, not helped by Matt’s scheming gay boss (Roger Daltrey) and possessive flatmate, who seek to break them up. Cast includes Steve Bell, Ian Rose and Dani Behr.

results.title: Lightning Jack
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Greg Coote, Paul Hogan, Village Roadshow Pictures and Lightning Ridge
results.brief_description: Paul Hogan is Lightning Jack Kane, an outlaw of legendary status, a bank robber who can shoot the eye out of a needle at 50 paces, a gunfighter quicker on the draw than Wyatt Earp and Doc Holliday - if only everyone else knew it! Co-starring Cuba Gooding Jnr as his mute sidekick and Beverly D’Angelo as the sultry saloon Madam, this is a comedy about two outlaws who just wanted to be wanted. This film is unique as it was the first Hollywood production to be floated on the stock market to raise the necessary production funds, with investors reaping a percentage of the profits, which unfortunately were not as much as expected.

results.title: Licence to kill (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The happy nuptials of James’ CIA buddy Felix Leiter (David Hedison) and bride-to-be Della are rudely interrupted when they embark on a mercy dash to capture drug lord Franz Sanchez (Robert Davi). Thanks to some aerial fishing though, their mission is successful and the parachuting groomsmen make it in time for the wedding. The happy couple are soon devastated however when Sanchez escapes and kills the bride and maims the groom as payback. This triggers best buddy James (Timothy Dalton) to relinquish his secret service status and licence to kill authority (Bond is under orders to complete another mission) as he embarks on a personal vendetta to revenge Sanchez’s brutality towards his friends. Ably assisted by ex-Army pilot Pam Bouvier (Carey Lowell), Bond flies into Isthmus City to infiltrate himself into Sanchez’s posse where he discovers a television evangelist (Wayne Newton) providing a front for cocaine dealing. Featuring a plethora of water inspired stunts earlier on in the film, the cast also includes Benicio Del Toro as a brooding henchman and Talisa Soto as Lupe Lamore, Sanchez’s mistress, eye candy, and source of jealousy for Bouvier. This was Timothy Dalton’s last appearance as Bond.

results.title: Library of Congress
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The American Scene”.
An account of the scope and methods of operation of the Library of Congress at Washington. Science, painting, music, literature and history are shown as some of the interests of the Institution. The library’s contents include valuable historical documents, newsreel records of outstanding events and personalities, Braille and talking books (on disc) for the blind, in addition to much material of general public interest. Includes a concert performance of music from manuscript collection and library staff in the field recording little known folk musicians.

results.title: Letter to America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Correspondent”.
First of two programs exploring the rift between America and the Muslim world. Shortly after September 11 2001, Syrian born Rana Kabbani, returned to the Middle East to find out how Muslims have come to view the United States. Her journey took her to Egypt, the United Arab Emirates and Iran. She wanted to know why there was so much hatred towards America. Was it religious - Muslims against Christians - or were there other reasons for this apparent hatred? And yet for all the hatred and anger towards America, many Arabs expressed sympathy for the American people and made it clear that they did not condone terrorism or what occurred on September 11. The United States however is accused of interference and domination, hypocrisy and double standards, exploiting the Middle East for its oil and using their land for its military bases - 27,000 American military personnel are currently based in the desert of Egypt. This documentary presents a Muslim perspective from the street Arabs to the intelligentsia and includes interviews with Egyptian filmmaker Khaled Youssef (“The Storm”), Iraqui musician Naseer Shamma, Palestinian journalist Atef Helwa, Sheik Nahyan one of the ruling elite in the United Arab Emirates, various academics and and a group of American Christian students on a study tour of the Middle East. Also discusses America’s close relationship with Israel, its past occupations, bombings and economic exploitations which have affected many countries around the world, but particularly the Islamic countries including Afghanistan, Iran, Iraq and Palestine. A most interesting insight into the hearts and minds of a people often portrayed in a damming way by the politicians and media of the West. Contains archival and some b&w footage. For more information: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/programmes/correspondent/1698317.stm

A most interesting insight into the hearts and minds of a people often portrayed in a damming way by the politicians and media of the West. Contains archival and some b&w footage.
